required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fish Oil and Folate Supplementation During Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: Dietary Supply of Docosahexaenoic Acid (DHA) and 5-methyl-tetrahydro-folate (MTHF) During the Second Half of Pregnancy and Early Infancy

brief_summary.textblock:
Pregnant women are randomised to supplementation with fish oil, methyl tetrahydro folic acid, both or a placebo during the second half of pregnancy. Biochemical measures are determined in maternal blood during pregnancy and in cord blood.
Non invasive follow up examinations of infants at ages 4, 5.5, 6.5, 7.5, 8, 9 and 9.5 years focus on long term effects of supplementation anthropometric development, neurological development and allergy risk.

primary_outcome.measure: percentage contribution of docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) to total phospholipid fatty acids in cord blood
primary_outcome.description: the biochemical efficacy of supplementation during pregnancy is tested by measuring the DHA content of cord blood phospholipids, as direct supplementation (fish oil) or increased perfusion of the placenta (MTHF) could both influence this parameter

secondary_outcome.measure: neurological and cognitive development of the offspring
secondary_outcome.time_frame: age 4 years, 5.5 years, 6.5 years, 7.5 years, 8 years, 9 years, 9.5 years
secondary_outcome.description: non invasive, age adequate, tests of neurological and cognitive function are performed at various ages of the offspring

secondary_outcome.time_frame: age 4 years, 5.5 years, 6.5 years, 8 years, 9.5 years
secondary_outcome.description: body weight (including weight of fat and non fat mass by bioelectrical impedance at later ages) is determined

secondary_outcome.time_frame: age 4 years, 5.5 years, 6.5 years, 8 years, 9.5 years
secondary_outcome.description: body height is measured at ages 4 years, 5.5 years, 6.5 years, 8 years, 9.5 years

secondary_outcome.time_frame: age 4 years, 5.5 years, 6.5 years, 7.5 years, 8 years, 9 years, 9.5 years
secondary_outcome.description: information on medical history, life sytyle and dietary habits is collected via questionnaires and non invasivly collected of biological samples (urine, cheek cells)
at age 8 years and 9.5 years an EEG is obtained while the children are performing defined tests

arm_group.description: the participating women receive a milk based supplement providing vitamins and mineral as recommended for pregnant women and 500 mg DHA and 150 eicosapentaenoic acid per day from gestational week 22 until delivery

the participating women receive a milk based supplement providing vitamins and mineral as recommended for pregnant women and 400 µg folate (methyltetrahydrofolate)per day from gestational week 22 until delivery

the participating women receive a milk based supplement providing vitamins and mineral as recommended for pregnant women and 500 mg DHA, 150 mg eicosapentaenoic acid and 400 µg MTHF per day from gestational week 22 until delivery
the participating women receive a milk based supplement providing vitamins and mineral as recommended for pregnant women from gestational week 22 until delivery

intervention.description: 400 mg of DHA and 150 mg of eicosapentaenoic acid per day
500 mg DHA, 150 mg eicosapentaenoic acid, 400 µg MTHF per day
only vitamins and minerals as recommended, but no fish oil or folate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- singleton pregnancy
- gestation <20 week at enrollment
- intention to deliver in one of the study centers
- body weight at time of enrollment from 50 kg to 92 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- serious chronic illness (eg, diabetes, hepatitis)
- use fish oil supplements since the beginning of pregnancy
- use of folate or vitamin B-12 supplements after gestation week 16

overall_official.affiliation: Dr. von Hauner Childrens Hospital, Ludwig-Maximilians-University Munich

facility.name: Dr. von Hauner Childrens Hospital, Ludwig-Maximilians-University
Department of Paediatrics, University of Granada

results_reference.citation: Krauss-Etschmann S, Shadid R, Campoy C, Hoster E, Demmelmair H, Jiménez M, Gil A, Rivero M, Veszprémi B, Decsi T, Koletzko BV; Nutrition and Health Lifestyle (NUHEAL) Study Group. Effects of fish-oil and folate supplementation of pregnant women on maternal and fetal plasma concentrations of docosahexaenoic acid and eicosapentaenoic acid: a European randomized multicenter trial. Am J Clin Nutr. 2007 May;85(5):1392-400.

clinical_study.keyword: long term consequences for the offspring
